instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2016 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not booting
threads.message:
Hi, I got the macbook pro 2016 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that doesnt boot, I checked almost all rails and they are present, didnt find any short and the amp sequence looks ok but doesnt boot. trackpad enabled, keyboard shift key light not present, when I insert a usb stick its light turns on for a sec. but then no activity. with display disconnected and connected to external monitor same problem. I reflashed the bios with a clean me bin that I downloaded from this forum no difference.

L7211, L7221, L7231 on boot: 1.112 then 0.700 A

PCH and other chips get hot but not really hot (please see pics)
The videos are the amperage behaviour while booting, the first is with the battery attached, the second is without battery attached. When the battery is connected doesnt make one reboot cycle. I think the battery is already charged because before with the battery connected it was using like 1Amp more. Both videos are with the board connected (everything connected) I tried disconnecting one by one trackpad, keyboard, touchpad, etc and same problem.

Battery attached
[MEDIA=imgur]a/SO7Fh0y[/MEDIA]

No Battery attached
[MEDIA=imgur]a/0enoGKa[/MEDIA]

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2016 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not booting
threads.message:
Any history available?
CPU core should drop to 0.6V aprox, when machine really boots.

There may be CPU, or GPU problem.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2016 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not booting
threads.message:
No history it came like that "its not turning on anymore, fans spin but nothing comes on the screen" 
no signs of water nothing..

<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> : 3.3V

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2016 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not booting
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> : 3.3V"
Once power on sequence is completed, there must be some communication problem on a data bus.
"There may be CPU, or GPU problem."

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2016 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not booting
threads.message: hmmmm is a there a procedure to check if it is a CPU or GPU problem?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2016 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not booting
threads.message: Not sure if helps on this model; lift GPU core coils and check if CPU core drops to 0.6V.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2016 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not booting
